title: yasuo needs an early game nerf
body: so before you downvote me and call me with all sort of names ,cough yasuo mains cough, i feel like his early game stats aren't that bad for a late game monster that he is at this moment and does not seems to get punished that hard espesially in mid and correct me if im wrong

How to fix yas

Remove double crit from passive

Add it to his windwall for a 20/40/60/80/100% crit is added into additional crit chance (rank 1 wind wall with 20% crit gives 4% bonus crit resulting in 24% crit chance)

As compensation yas dash now generates flow again

This cuts down his kill potential in lane but enforces his "move to survive" playstyle

Until mid/ late game whe he starts lvling wind wall

Edit: just to clarify his Q and AA crits still receive the current pentaly of reduced crit damage, this change is just designed to delay his power spike seeing as he can now get 100% crit off 1 item and crit runes with the 100% crit bonus
This is actually a really good way to balance his early game while keeping with his late game hypercarry.

the point of yasuo is to eliminate Chance from crit as soon as possible to give him a mid game spike. the true balance comes from the crit damage reduction which has foolishly been left at a 10% reduction on his *passive*. I would recommend that in the early game, he has a little less starting AD but scales up to the same amount late game, and for crit, he starts out at 40% initial crit reduction that scales up 38%/35%/30%/22%/10% with ranks in his q (75%/60%/50%/39%/25% on active ability). additionally, leveling up his windwall should mean something so i suggest moving the sheild health scaling from his passive onto this with 100 initial flow amount scaling to 150/225/300/400/510 with each rank in w, as well as making his w requires a certain amount of flow (say 100) and consumes half of that (eg 50) until he max ranks the ability, so he has to choose to block ranged damage completely or be safe from burst. finally yasuo's e is indeed powerful but it has it's drawbacks in that he can be stopped with cc unlike master yi's alpha strike and after he casts it, he is stuck for up to a half a second traveling a fixed distance, which you can easily set up an aoe stun for. for the e I would simply shift the scaling of his flow regeneration with 60 initial and 59/57/55/52/48 by rank of e. because he's going to level it up anyways and charge his flow faster no matter what.

when these changes are all taken into account, this changes the way yasuo is played situationally. because of the exponential scaling, yasuo is pretty dang weak early game. from level 1, a yasuo player has to take into account who he's up against and make a decision on how to level by the time he reaches rank 4. he could go the normal route with maxing r, e, q then w, but then he'd miss out on the damage he'd output against a squishy target with maxing his q to get his crit back to 10% reduced without items, or the security from burst like a level 6 rengar gank. he'd have to give up some stats in exchange for something else, adding long term planning and foresight on the yasuo player's behalf. additionally by tying these stats to ability rank, it would effectively delay some of his power spike until mid game and keep him rising as a melee carry when the game goes on(power spike on level 6, static shiv, maxing first ability, ie, maxing second ability, Lifesteal item, maxing ult, situational items, maxing final ability [all of which happen post level 6]). if this somehow weakens him to a below 38% win-rate or hardly gets picked, to compensate for his weak early game, they could potentially scale his late game damage or give him a 2 AD boost or nerf early game. the scaling on the passives could be touched up a little if necessary, which is the point: if he's too strong because of  a specific playstyle, they can adjust the way that he scales without gutting him or taking away the point of building crit on him early.

TL;DR: keep double crit, add Scalings of other passives to ranks in abilities.

changing the flow shield passive scaling to his W would honestly be terrible, because that just straight up nerfs it since even then he would be maxing it last (weaker by level until he starts adding more points to it to eventually even out, so nerfed entirely up to level 18). But the changing it to costing half his maximum flow wouldn't be a bad idea IF he gets too oppressive to ranged champs (right now it is about how it should be where there are clear matchups he is favored but not absolute dominance).

The wording on your E changes are a little confusing, looks like you are having him generate less flow when leveling E? that seems a little counter-intuitive. Honestly his E is fine as is, there is a lot of power already given for maxing it. (ties directly to his in lane mobility and trading)

The crit reduction being tied to his Q is kinda interesting though, as it gives a clear reason to max it when farming well to hit his item spikes.

honestly though Alfavhunters change proposal is way easier and would feel better to have implemented

If it fixes Yasuo's weird scaling while also making him less frustrating to fight and more fair to allow his win rate to actually hover around 50% instead of its usual 47% or so, that sounds great.

And again with the True Damage fear mongering.
What kind of steroid do you suggest instead of double crit then?

Well for a start, it has to do an entirely different job than giving Yasuo hyper accelerated mid game scaling (double crit chance) while also punching at his late game scaling (hit the crit cap, reducing crit damage). It gives Yasuo the power curve and thus the Burst Damage of an Assassin, something that doesn't make sense if we consider Yasuo a DPS champion (which is further reinforced by his reliance on Attack Speed and Armor Penetration, mind you). One example is that maybe Critical Strikes can give him a minor attack speed boost, as this reinforces his job as a DPS Champion while also providing him reason to invest in Crit Chance like he does now.

We could replace the damage of the steroid entirely as well. Mind you that Yasuo is the most utility heavy Melee Carry of the Crit Based Melee Carries, why not keep playing on that by giving him a tool meant to aid him outside of raw damage? For example, Crit Chance plays into augmenting his Shield Passive, lengthening its duration or buffing its generation or raising how much it shields, for example (this also gives Yasuo only one true Passive). 

Probably my greatest criticism is that his current Passive is not something Yasuo _needs_ (well, maybe now he does, since they nerfed almost everything else in his kit without touching his Crit Chance passive). Yasuo does not _need_ a mid game damage spike, as that's the same reason why we criticized Vayne earlier in S5 (her Flat Damage and rushing an overtuned BotRK bumped her mid game higher than you'd expect of a hyper carry). He already has all sorts of tools unique to his kit that have nothing to do with raw damage, why don't we emphasize them more?
I'd say his balance lies in his crit reduction as it pertains to leveling.

It would still stunt his late game, given that he slams into the cap by the mid game and late game offensive options are few and far between since the Marksman update without wasting a lot of gold on Critical Chance.
